nodes.documentation:
This is a contract allowing users to mint random Skyweaver's
gold cards for a given weave amount using a future block hash commit scheme.
nodes.name: GoldCardsFactory
registerIDs
deregisterIDs
updateGoldPrice
updateGoldRefund

params._assetsAddr: The address of the ERC-1155 Assets Token
params._goldRefund: Amount of weave to receive when melting a gold card
params._rngDelay: Amount of blocks after commit before one can mint cards
params._weaveAddr: The address of the ERC-1155 Base Token
params._weaveID: The ID of the ERC-1155 Base Token

deregisterIDs(uint256[],uint256[]).details: Need to account for the fact that the array will change     as ids are removed, so the corresponding indexes will change     as well. Using decending order makes it easier.

params._cardPoolIndexes: The cardPools index for each id in _ids
params._ids: Array of card IDs to make non-purchasable

getOrderStatuses(bytes32[]).return: Status of the corresponding orders, where F is non-existant or executed and T is pending.

getPurchasableStatus(uint256[]).return: The purchasable status of card IDs provided

params._order: Order to get the RNG seed of

getRNGSeed((address,address,uint256,uint.return: rng seed for a given order

getRandomCards(bytes32,uint256).details: Ids returned are unsorted and duplicates are not stackedSee validateRandomCards() for modulo bias explaination

params._amount: Amount of random indexes to return

mineGolds((address,address,uint256,uint2.details: The ids to mint for a given order are generated and sorted off-chain     but their validity is verified on-chain before being minted.

params._ids: Sorted array of ids to mint
params._indexes: Array containing _ids indexes, ordered by the                 sequence in which they appear in the rng function.
params._order: GoldOrder object associated with the given order

onERC1155BatchReceived(address,address,u.details: `_data` must be encoded as follow: abi.encode(BuyCardsObj)

params._amounts: An array containing amounts of each Token being transferred
params._data: Encoded GoldOrder structure or recipient address if melting
params._from: The address which previously owned the Tokens
params._ids: An array containing ids of each Token being transferred

recommit((address,address,uint256,uint25.details: Can only be executed if an order is not executable anymore.

params._order: GoldOrder object associated with the given order to recommit

registerIDs(uint256[]).details: Will throw if an ID is already registered to prevent duplicates     in cardPool array.

params._ids: Array of asset IDs to allow for purchasing

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: This function MUST return true if it implements the ERC1155TokenReceiver interface and ERC-165 interface.     This function MUST NOT consume more than 5,000 gas.

params.interfaceID: The ERC-165 interface ID that is queried for support.s

supportsInterface(bytes4).return: Wheter ERC-165 or ERC1155TokenReceiver interfaces are supported.

updateGoldPrice(uint256).details: Don't forget to account for currency's decimalsDoes not account for card decimals

updateGoldRefund(uint256).details: Don't forget to account for the currency's decimals @dev Should ignore card's decimals

validateRandomCards(bytes32,uint256[],ui.details: The _order argument allows _ids to be sorted, which is necessary for     minting the asset (enforced by supply manager).Using modulo for randomness can introduce a significant bias where low index     cards have higher probability of being selected than others. This bias becomes     less significant with larger number/modulo ratio. One can calculate the bias as     ceil(k/n)/K - floor(K/n)/K, where K is the number and n is the modulo. In our     case, since we use an integer field of 2**256, this bias should be negligeable.     This is especially true considering the total # of gold cards will be low, hence     this is an acceptable bias for uniform sampling.

params._ids: Array of ids that will be generated from the _seed
params._indexes: Indexes in _ids sorted by the sequence in which they                will be generated from the random function.

validateRandomCards(bytes32,uint256[],ui.return: Array of how many copies for each ID was present

methods.constructor: Create factory, link factory manager and store initial paramters

deregisterIDs(uint256[],uint256[]).notice: Will indicate that asset ids in _ids are NOT mintable

getCardPool().notice: Returns the array containing all ids registered

getFactoryManager().notice: Returns the address of the factory manager contract

getGoldPrice().notice: Returns the current gold cards price in Weave

getGoldRefund().notice: Returns the current gold cards refund amount

getOrderStatuses(bytes32[]).notice: Get the order status for a an array of orders

getOwner().notice: Returns the address of the owner.

getPurchasableStatus(uint256[]).notice: Get the purchasable status of card IDs provided

getRNGSeed((address,address,uint256,uint.notice: Returns the RNG seed for a given block # and given address

getRandomCards(bytes32,uint256).notice: Will return _amount random ids based on seed (unsorted and doesn't stack duplicates)

getWeave().notice: Returns the address of the Arcadeun Coin contract

getWeaveID().notice: Returns the token ID of weave

mineGolds((address,address,uint256,uint2.notice: Commits weave for gold cards minting

onERC1155BatchReceived(address,address,u.notice: Handle which method is being called on transfer

recommit((address,address,uint256,uint25.notice: Recommit to future block for RNG if order wasn't executed in time

registerIDs(uint256[]).notice: Will indicate that asset ids in _ids are purchasable & add them to card pool

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: Indicates whether a contract implements the `ERC1155TokenReceiver` functions and so can accept ERC1155 token types.

transferOwnership(address).notice: Transfers the ownership of the contract to new address

updateGoldRefund(uint256).notice: Will update the card refund amount

updateRNGDelay(uint256).notice: Will update the rng delay amount

validateRandomCards(bytes32,uint256[],ui.notice: Will verify that for a given seed, the _ids array provided is correct

userdoc.notice: This is a contract allowing users to mint random Skyweaver's gold cards for a given weave amount using a future block hash commit scheme.
